intro: Botryopleuron yamatsutae, commonly known as the Japanese star-shaped fern, is a rare and unique plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Dryopteridaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, star-like fronds that resemble a cluster of small, rounded leaves. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and rocky crevices. Its botanical features include a short rhizome and intricate, dichotomous branching patterns in its fronds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
